title: No children node listing when changing data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab.
OB: The issue occurs when changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab. After creating a new dataset without an SQL statement and changing the data source in the dataset editor, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: When changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab, the expected behavior is to have a proper listing of children nodes, even when the new data source has no database/table/column information.
SR:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new dataset without an SQL statement.
2. In the dataset editor data source page, change the data source.
3. Note that the new data source has no database/table/column information.

Actual Result:
No children node listing when changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab. To reproduce, close the dataset editor and reopen it.
